video.title: What is Continuous Integration?
video.description:
Continuous integration is a software development practice where all the developers are continuously integrating small code changes back into the code base. 

CircleCI is a platform for continuous integration and delivery, helping developers ship code quickly and confidently. Join their developer advocate, Alek Sharma, as he explains the basics of continuous integration.

Start testing: https://circleci.com/freecodecamp/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Tung Vu Duc
topLevelComment.text:
- Who writes the test cases for test server ? 
- All the test cases will be wrote one time before developers start coding or it can be updated during features ?

topLevelComment.author: Anya Wisniewski
topLevelComment.text: Thanks! Clear and to the point!

topLevelComment.author: Justin Scofield
topLevelComment.text: Very short, very basic! Good video!

topLevelComment.author: Sergii Boiko
topLevelComment.text: finally a clear and simple explanation!

topLevelComment.author: Jonathan Lee
topLevelComment.text: missed out "fix test" next to "fix code" part of diagram

replies.author: Jonathan Lee
replies.text:
Yep what i mean is tests can become redundant over time,  ie the case you write code though don't keep the tests up to date.

I guess your coming at from the order of write tests to specify features, then write code TDD. In the case i'm in on an projects it the other way around write code features,  then write test for the features, and although fully functional the older tests are failing yet from an UI perpective things are working.
